native_answer: Ein Strauß: Ich habe einen Strauß Blumen gepflückt.
prompt: ______: I picked a bunch of flowers.
answer: A bunch of: I picked a bunch of flowers.
audio_dir: A bunch of: I picked a bunch of flowers.

native_answer: Ein paar (zählbar): Sie hat ein paar enge Freunde.
prompt: ______ (countable): She has a few close friends.
answer: A few (countable): She has a few close friends.
audio_dir: A few (countable): She has a few close friends.

native_answer: Ein bisschen (unzählbar): Ich nehme noch ein bisschen Kaffee.
prompt: ______ (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.
answer: A little (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.
audio_dir: A little (uncountable): I’ll have a little more coffee.

native_answer: Viel: Es gibt heute viel Verkehr.
prompt: ______: There’s a lot of traffic today.
answer: A lot: There’s a lot of traffic today.
audio_dir: A lot: There’s a lot of traffic today.

native_answer: Eine Menge: Er hat eine Menge Snacks mitgebracht.
prompt: ______: He brought a ton of snacks.
answer: A ton of: He brought a ton of snacks.
audio_dir: A ton of: He brought a ton of snacks.

native_answer: Alle: Alle Tickets sind ausverkauft.
prompt: ______: ______ the tickets are sold out.
answer: All: All the tickets are sold out.
audio_dir: All: All the tickets are sold out.

native_answer: Eine übermäßige Menge an: Das Unternehmen hat eine übermäßige Menge Geld für Werbung ausgegeben.
prompt: ______: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.
answer: An excessive amount of: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.
audio_dir: An excessive amount of: The company spent an excessive amount of money on advertising.

native_answer: Ein paar: Hast du ein paar Fragen?
prompt: ______: Do you have any questions?
answer: Any: Do you have any questions?
audio_dir: Any: Do you have any questions?

native_answer: So viele wie: Es gab bis zu 50 Teilnehmer.
prompt: As many as: There were ______ 50 participants.
answer: As many as: There were as many as 50 participants.
audio_dir: As many as: There were as many as 50 participants.

native_answer: So viel wie: Er isst nicht so viel wie ich.
prompt: As much as: He doesn’t eat ______ I do.
answer: As much as: He doesn’t eat as much as I do.
audio_dir: As much as: He doesn’t eat as much as I do.

native_answer: Beide: Beide Antworten sind korrekt.
prompt: ______: ______ answers are correct.
answer: Both: Both answers are correct.
audio_dir: Both: Both answers are correct.

native_answer: Jeder: Jeder Student hat ein Buch erhalten.
prompt: ______: ______ student received a book.
answer: Each: Each student received a book.
audio_dir: Each: Each student received a book.

native_answer: Jeder: Jedes Kind verdient eine Bildung.
prompt: ______: ______ child deserves an education.
answer: Every: Every child deserves an education.
audio_dir: Every: Every child deserves an education.

native_answer: Wenig (zählbar): Wenige Menschen kennen die Wahrheit.
prompt: ______ (countable): ______ people know the truth.
answer: Few (countable): Few people know the truth.
audio_dir: Few (countable): Few people know the truth.

native_answer: Weniger: Heute sind weniger Autos auf der Straße.
prompt: Fewer: There are ______ cars on the road today.
answer: Fewer: There are fewer cars on the road today.
audio_dir: Fewer: There are fewer cars on the road today.

native_answer: Kaum etwas: Es ist kaum Milch im Kühlschrank.
prompt: ______: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.
answer: Hardly any: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.
audio_dir: Hardly any: There’s hardly any milk in the fridge.

native_answer: Weniger: Wir sollten weniger Zeit mit dieser Aufgabe verbringen.
prompt: Less: We should spend ______ time on this task.
answer: Less: We should spend less time on this task.
audio_dir: Less: We should spend less time on this task.

native_answer: Wenig: Es gibt wenig Hoffnung auf Erfolg.
prompt: ______: There’s little hope for success.
answer: Little: There’s little hope for success.
audio_dir: Little: There’s little hope for success.

native_answer: Viele: Sie hat viele Ideen.
prompt: ______: She has lots of ideas.
answer: Lots of: She has lots of ideas.
audio_dir: Lots of: She has lots of ideas.

native_answer: Viele (zählbar): Wie viele Leute kommen?

audio_dir: Many (countable): How many people are coming?

native_answer: Mehr: Ich brauche mehr Wasser, um die Flasche zu füllen.
prompt: More: I need ______ water to fill the bottle.
answer: More: I need more water to fill the bottle.
audio_dir: More: I need more water to fill the bottle.

native_answer: Viel (unzählbar): Es ist nicht mehr viel Zucker übrig.
prompt: ______ (uncountable): There isn’t much sugar left.

audio_dir: Not as many as: There aren’t as many as we expected.

native_answer: Nicht so viel wie: Sie schläft nicht so viel wie ihr Bruder.

prompt: ______ (countable): ______ students attended the lecture.

native_answer: Genug: Wir haben genug Zeit, um fertig zu werden.
